frameDefinitions: A Perceiver determines the Location of a Sought_entity within a Ground.
A Theme is in a stable position with respect to a Location.
This frame has to do with people (the Residents) residing in Locations, sometimes with a Co-resident.
An Agent restricts the movement of a Theme to within the vicinity of the Holding_location, despite the Theme's desire, plan, or tendency towards motion; the Agent may also use an Instrument.
An Agent begins preventing a Captive from moving despite a tendency or desire on the part of the Captive to do so.
This frame is concerned with Cognizers remembering and forgetting mental Content.
frameExamples: Kim <t>found</t> his hat on the far side.
Our offices are <t>located</t> about two miles south of I-85 .
They <t>held</t> the package for two months in the border-patrol locker room .
Authorities recently <t>captured</t> several suspects who were hiding in a remote mountain area.
listRoleDefinitions: The individual that determines the <fen>Location</fen> of the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> succeeds in finding.
The position of the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The general set of entities that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> examined in order to find the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Sought_entity</fen> is located.
An entity which is at a particular Location
A salient entity that the <fen>Theme</fen> is located with respect to.
The time at which the <fen>Theme</fen> is at the <fen>Location</fen>.
The location (generally presumed to be known to the interlocutor) with respect to which the location of the <fen>Theme</fen> can be understood.
The individual(s) that reside at the <fen>Location</fen>.
The place in which somebody resides.
A person or group of people that the resident is staying with or among.
This role refers to the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Resident</fen> resides.
The entity which is confined.
The area within which the <fen>Theme</fen> comes to be confined.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person intentionally restricting the movement of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-sentient entity which is responsible for restricting the movement or location of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
When the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
The entity which is captured.
The <fen>Agent</fen> brings the <fen>Captive</fen> into custody.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-sentient entity which is responsible for restricting the movement or location of the <fen>Captive</fen>.
When the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose mental <fen>Content</fen> is at issue.
The <fen>Content</fen> is the mental content that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> retains or forgets.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject the <fen>Cognizer</fen> mental <fen>Content</fen> is about.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the remembering or forgetting of mental <fen>Content</fen> occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the remembering or forgetting takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>I</fex> finally found the peanut underneath the couch cusion.
Sam located the Imperial regal <fex>among the coins in his pocket</fex> and passed it to the boy.
He confined <fex>340 mutineers</fex> in Burford Church for the next three days under general sentence of death.
He confined 340 mutineers <fex>in Burford Church</fex> for the next three days under general sentence of death.
<fex>He</fex> confined 340 mutineers in Burford Church for the next three days under general sentence of death.
Police have captured <fex>three of the suspected bombers</fex> after a week-long search.
<fex>Authorities</fex> recently captured several suspects who were hiding in a remote mountain area.
Authorities secured the target <fex>in a private residence</fex>.
Each student must be able to recall <fex>the whole paragraph</fex>  .
